author: abcoathup
content:
Is PR 7210 (https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/7210) claiming ERC 7210 a case of number sniping?

It looks like one of the files was renamed to 7210 before the PR was created? (But I am not confident in my reading of the Github history)
https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/commits/ad64bc0c7a4ae684e3a8f0f6a2c57f9d56b12d08/assets/eip-7210/eip-7210-compat.md

There is nothing for 7209, 7208, so assume they were deleted by someone and the PR was created 35 minutes after PR 7207

If this was number sniping, I suggest manually renumbering to ERC7208

author: samwilsn

author: samwilsn
content: Since it's NFT related and "721" is a significant number, there are likely spam issues involved, and the short amount of time involved... I would suspect sniping.

author: abcoathup
content:
I've manually reassigned, I had completely missed the 7210 relationship.

Is there any way to find what were the deleted issues 7208/7209?
